content.description: Catalase is a protein enzyme that catalyzes the breakdown of hydrogen peroxide <math alttext="or H 2 O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> into water and oxygen gas in the cells of many living organisms. Students used an online database, which used the structure of catalase from different species, to generate the phylogenetic tree shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. Relationships of selected organisms based on catalase structure Which of the following student claims is best supported by the data provided?

choices.label: Mushrooms and potatoes are most closely related, since the node they share gave rise to all of the other organisms.
Cattle are equally related to pigs and sheep, because the phylogeny places cattle between pigs and sheep.
Yeast and mushrooms are the most closely related, because they are both fungi.
Cattle and sheep are separated by only one node, and they are separated from the other organisms by more than one node.

content.answer: Cattle and sheep are separated by only one node, and they are separated from the other organisms by more than one node.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
